p: Papillary thyroid cancer (PTC) is the most common type of differentiated thyroid cancer, which account for 85%-90% of all cases ( 1). The incidence of PTC has been rapidly increasing globally because of early detection ( 2). According to the World Health Organization (WHO), PTMC is defined as PTC with maximum diameter of 10mm. Those with maximum diameter of more than 10mm is called CPTC ( 3).
